law.catch_line: A victim or victim's representative who receives notification under § 11-113(b) of this subtitle ma...

text.section: A victim or victim's representative who receives notification under § 11-113(b) of this subtitle may disclose the results of the test to another person to protect the health and safety of, or to seek compensation for, the victim, the victim's sexual partner, or the victim's family.

section.section: Except as otherwise provided in Part II of this subtitle, a person who receives notification or disclosure of the results of the test under subsection (a) of this section may not knowingly disclose the results of that test.
A person who violates this subsection is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 90 days or a fine not exceeding $5,000 or both.
